verses.kjv: These are now the chief of their fathers, and this is the genealogy of them that went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king.
verses.web: Now these are the heads of their fathers’ households, and this is the genealogy of those who went up with me from Babylon, in the reign of Artaxerxes the king:
verses.ct: Here are the family leaders and their genealogies — the people who traveled with me from Babylon during the reign of King Artaxerxes.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Phinehas; Gershom: of the sons of Ithamar; Daniel: of the sons of David; Hattush.
verses.web: Of the sons of Phinehas, Gershom. Of the sons of Ithamar, Daniel. Of the sons of David, Hattush.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Phinehas: Gershom. From the descendants of Ithamar: Daniel. From the descendants of David: Hattush.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Shechaniah, of the sons of Pharosh; Zechariah: and with him were reckoned by genealogy of the males an hundred and fifty.
verses.web: Of the sons of Shecaniah, of the sons of Parosh, Zechariah; and with him were listed by genealogy of the males one hundred fifty.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Shechaniah, of the line of Pharosh: Zechariah, along with 150 males listed in his genealogy.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Pahathmoab; Elihoenai the son of Zerahiah, and with him two hundred males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Pahathmoab, Eliehoenai the son of Zerahiah; and with him two hundred males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Pahathmoab: Elihoenai son of Zerahiah, along with 200 males.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Shechaniah; the son of Jahaziel, and with him three hundred males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Shecaniah, the son of Jahaziel; and with him three hundred males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Shechaniah: the son of Jahaziel, along with 300 males.

verses.kjv: Of the sons also of Adin; Ebed the son of Jonathan, and with him fifty males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Adin, Ebed the son of Jonathan; and with him fifty males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Adin: Ebed son of Jonathan, along with 50 males.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Elam; Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah, and with him seventy males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Elam, Jeshaiah the son of Athaliah; and with him seventy males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Elam: Jeshaiah son of Athaliah, along with 70 males.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Shephatiah; Zebadiah the son of Michael, and with him fourscore males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Shephatiah, Zebadiah the son of Michael; and with him eighty males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Shephatiah: Zebadiah son of Michael, along with 80 males.

verses.kjv: Of the sons of Joab; Obadiah the son of Jehiel, and with him two hundred and eighteen males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Joab, Obadiah the son of Jehiel; and with him two hundred eighteen males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Joab: Obadiah son of Jehiel, along with 218 males.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Shelomith; the son of Josiphiah, and with him an hundred and threescore males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Shelomith, the son of Josiphiah; and with him one hundred sixty males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Shelomith: the son of Josiphiah, along with 160 males.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Bebai; Zechariah the son of Bebai, and with him twenty and eight males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Bebai, Zechariah the son of Bebai; and with him twenty-eight males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Bebai: Zechariah son of Bebai, along with 28 males.

verses.kjv: And of the sons of Azgad; Johanan the son of Hakkatan, and with him an hundred and ten males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Azgad, Johanan the son of Hakkatan; and with him one hundred ten males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Azgad: Johanan son of Hakkatan, along with 110 males.

verses.kjv: And of the last sons of Adonikam, whose names are these, Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah, and with them threescore males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Adonikam, who were the last; and these are their names: Eliphelet, Jeuel, and Shemaiah; and with them sixty males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Adonikam — the last ones to leave — came Eliphelet, Jeiel, and Shemaiah, along with 60 males.

verses.kjv: Of the sons also of Bigvai; Uthai, and Zabbud, and with them seventy males.
verses.web: Of the sons of Bigvai, Uthai and Zabbud; and with them seventy males.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Bigvai: Uthai and Zabbud, along with 70 males.

verses.kjv: And I gathered them together to the river that runneth to Ahava; and there abode we in tents three days: and I viewed the people, and the priests, and found there none of the sons of Levi.
verses.web: I gathered them together to the river that runs to Ahava; and there we encamped three days: and I looked around at the people and the priests, and found there were none of the sons of Levi.
verses.ct: I gathered everyone together at the river that flows toward Ahava, and we camped there for 3 days. As I looked over the group — the people and the priests — I realized that not a single Levite was among us.

verses.kjv: Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, and for Elnathan, and for Jarib, and for Elnathan, and for Nathan, and for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib, and for Elnathan, men of understanding.
verses.web: Then sent I for Eliezer, for Ariel, for Shemaiah, for Elnathan, for Jarib, for Elnathan, for Nathan, for Zechariah, and for Meshullam, chief men; also for Joiarib and for Elnathan, who were teachers.
verses.ct: So I sent for Eliezer, Ariel, Shemaiah, Elnathan, Jarib, Elnathan, Nathan, Zechariah, and Meshullam, who were leaders, along with Joiarib and Elnathan, who were teachers.

verses.kjv: And I sent them with commandment unto Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia, and I told them what they should say unto Iddo, and to his brethren the Nethinims, at the place Casiphia, that they should bring unto us ministers for the house of our God.
verses.web: I sent them out to Iddo the chief at the place Casiphia; and I told them what they should tell Iddo, and his brothers the temple servants, at the place Casiphia, that they should bring to us ministers for the house of our God.
verses.ct: I sent them to Iddo, the leader at the settlement of Casiphia, and told them exactly what to say to Iddo and his fellow temple servants there — that they should send us people to serve in the house of our God.

verses.kjv: And by the good hand of our God upon us they brought us a man of understanding, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brethren, eighteen;
verses.web: According to the good hand of our God on us they brought us a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brothers, eighteen;
verses.ct: Because God's gracious hand was on us, they brought us a capable man named Sherebiah, a descendant of Mahli, who was a descendant of Levi, who was a son of Israel. Sherebiah came with his sons and relatives — 18 men in all.

verses.kjv: And Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brethren and their sons, twenty;
verses.web: and Hashabiah, and with him Jeshaiah of the sons of Merari, his brothers and their sons, twenty;
verses.ct: They also brought Hashabiah, along with Jeshaiah from the descendants of Merari, together with his relatives and their sons — 20 men.

verses.kjv: Also of the Nethinims, whom David and the princes had appointed for the service of the Levites, two hundred and twenty Nethinims: all of them were expressed by name.
verses.web: and of the temple servants, whom David and the princes had given for the service of the Levites, two hundred twenty temple servants. All of them were mentioned by name.
verses.ct: They also brought 220 temple servants — people whose ancestors had been assigned by David and his officials to assist the Levites. Every one of them was registered by name.

verses.kjv: Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river of Ahava, that we might afflict ourselves before our God, to seek of him a right way for us, and for our little ones, and for all our substance.
verses.web: Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God, to seek from him a straight way for us, and for our little ones, and for all our possessions.
verses.ct: There at the river of Ahava, I called for a fast so we could humble ourselves before our God and ask him for a safe journey for us, our children, and all our possessions.

verses.kjv: For I was ashamed to require of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way: because we had spoken unto the king, saying, The hand of our God is upon all them for good that seek him; but his power and his wrath is against all them that forsake him.
verses.web: For I was ashamed to ask of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy on the way, because we had spoken to the king, saying, “The hand of our God is on all those who seek him, for good; but his power and his wrath is against all those who forsake him.”
verses.ct: I was too ashamed to ask the king for soldiers and cavalry to protect us on the road, because we had already told him, "Our God's hand protects everyone who seeks him, but his power and wrath turn against everyone who abandons him."

verses.kjv: So we fasted and besought our God for this: and he was intreated of us.
verses.web: So we fasted and begged our God for this: and he granted our request.
verses.ct: So we fasted and prayed to our God about this, and he answered our prayer.

verses.kjv: Then I separated twelve of the chief of the priests, Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brethren with them,
verses.web: Then I set apart twelve of the chiefs of the priests, even Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and ten of their brothers with them,
verses.ct: Then I set apart 12 of the leading priests — Sherebiah, Hashabiah, and 10 of their fellow priests —

verses.kjv: And weighed unto them the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, even the offering of the house of our God, which the king, and his counsellors, and his lords, and all Israel there present, had offered:
verses.web: and weighed to them the silver, the gold, and the vessels, even the offering for the house of our God, which the king, his counselors, his princes, and all Israel there present, had offered.
verses.ct: and I weighed out to them the silver, the gold, and the sacred vessels that the king, his advisors, his officials, and all the Israelites present had contributed for the house of our God.

verses.kjv: I even weighed unto their hand six hundred and fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels an hundred talents, and of gold an hundred talents;
verses.web: I weighed into their hand six hundred fifty talents of silver, one hundred talents of silver vessels; one hundred talents of gold,
verses.ct: I weighed out and handed over to them 650 talents of silver, 100 talents' worth of silver vessels, and 100 talents of gold,

verses.kjv: Also twenty basons of gold, of a thousand drams; and two vessels of fine copper, precious as gold.
verses.web: twenty bowls of gold weighing one thousand darics; and two vessels of fine bright bronze, precious as gold.
verses.ct: along with 20 gold bowls worth 1,000 darics, and 2 vessels of fine polished bronze, as precious as gold.

verses.kjv: And I said unto them, Ye are holy unto the LORD; the vessels are holy also; and the silver and the gold are a freewill offering unto the LORD God of your fathers.
verses.web: I said to them, “You are holy to LORD, and the vessels are holy. The silver and the gold are a free will offering to LORD, the God of your fathers.
verses.ct: I told them, "You are set apart as holy to the LORD, and these vessels are holy too. The silver and gold are a freewill offering to the LORD, the God of your ancestors.

verses.kjv: Watch ye, and keep them, until ye weigh them before the chief of the priests and the Levites, and chief of the fathers of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the chambers of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Watch and keep them, until you weigh them before the chiefs of the priests and the Levites, and the princes of the fathers’ households of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the rooms of LORD’s house.”
verses.ct: Guard them carefully until you weigh them out in Jerusalem, in the chambers of the LORD's house, before the leading priests, the Levites, and the heads of Israel's families."

verses.kjv: So took the priests and the Levites the weight of the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem unto the house of our God.
verses.web: So the priests and the Levites received the weight of the silver and the gold, and the vessels, to bring them to Jerusalem to the house of our God.
verses.ct: So the priests and Levites accepted the weighed-out silver, gold, and vessels to carry them to Jerusalem, to the house of our God.

verses.kjv: Then we departed from the river of Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go unto Jerusalem: and the hand of our God was upon us, and he delivered us from the hand of the enemy, and of such as lay in wait by the way.
verses.web: Then we departed from the river Ahava on the twelfth day of the first month, to go to Jerusalem. The hand of our God was on us, and he delivered us from the hand of the enemy and the bandit by the way.
verses.ct: We left the river of Ahava on the 12th day of the 1st month, heading for Jerusalem. God's hand was on us, and he protected us from enemies and bandits along the way.

verses.kjv: And we came to Jerusalem, and abode there three days.
verses.web: We came to Jerusalem, and stayed there three days.
verses.ct: We arrived in Jerusalem and rested there for 3 days.

verses.kjv: Now on the fourth day was the silver and the gold and the vessels weighed in the house of our God by the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, Levites;
verses.web: On the fourth day the silver and the gold and the vessels were weighed in the house of our God into the hand of Meremoth the son of Uriah the priest; and with him was Eleazar the son of Phinehas; and with them was Jozabad the son of Jeshua, and Noadiah the son of Binnui, the Levite;
verses.ct: On the 4th day, the silver, gold, and vessels were weighed out in the house of our God. Meremoth son of Uriah the priest was in charge, assisted by Eleazar son of Phinehas, along with the Levites Jozabad son of Jeshua and Noadiah son of Binnui.

verses.kjv: By number and by weight of every one: and all the weight was written at that time.
verses.web: everything by number and by weight; and all the weight was written at that time.
verses.ct: Every item was counted and weighed, and the total weight was recorded right then and there.

verses.kjv: Also the children of those that had been carried away, which were come out of the captivity, offered burnt offerings unto the God of Israel, twelve bullocks for all Israel, ninety and six rams, seventy and seven lambs, twelve he goats for a sin offering: all this was a burnt offering unto the LORD.
verses.web: The children of the captivity, who had come out of exile, offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel, twelve bulls for all Israel, ninety-six rams, seventy-seven lambs, and twelve male goats for a sin offering. All this was a burnt offering to LORD.
verses.ct: The exiles who had returned from captivity offered burnt offerings to the God of Israel: 12 bulls for all Israel, 96 rams, 77 lambs, and 12 male goats as a sin offering. All of this was presented as a burnt offering to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they delivered the king’s commissions unto the king’s lieutenants, and to the governors on this side the river: and they furthered the people, and the house of God.
verses.web: They delivered the king’s commissions to the king’s local governors, and to the governors beyond the River. So they supported the people and God’s house.
verses.ct: They also delivered the king's official orders to the royal governors and the officials of the province west of the Euphrates, and those officials gave their full support to the people and to the house of God.
